message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of reconstructing a polygon from its visibility graph, which is a classic problem in computational geometry. Therefore, cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a linear time algorithm for reconstructing a pseudo-triangle, which involves graph theory and data structures, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) another likely sub-category. The paper also introduces a set of necessary and sufficient properties for characterizing visibility graphs of pseudo-triangles, which falls under cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). The paper also discusses the complexity of the problem and proposes polynomial algorithms, which falls under cs.GT (Computational Complexity) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity and Cryptography).
